content:
Pen Class

Definition

Describes how a shape is outlined.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public sealed class Pen : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Properties

Brush

Gets or sets the fill the outline produced by this Pen.

public System.Windows.Media.Brush Brush { get; set; }
Value
Brush

The fill of the outline produced by this Pen. The default value is null.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field BrushProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

DashCap

Gets or sets a value that specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.

public System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap DashCap { get; set; }
Value
PenLineCap

Specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.

This setting applies to both ends of each dash. The default value is PenLineCap.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DashCapProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

DashStyle

Gets or sets a value that describes the pattern of dashes generated by this Pen.

public System.Windows.Media.DashStyle DashStyle { get; set; }
Value
DashStyle

A value that describes the pattern of dashes generated by this Pen. The default is stem.Windows.Media.DashStyles.Solid*, which indicates that there should be no dashes.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

The DashStyles class provides a set of predefined dash patterns.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DashStyleProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

EndLineCap

Gets or sets the type of shape to use at the end of a stroke.

public System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap EndLineCap { get; set; }
Value
PenLineCap

The type of shape that ends the stroke. The default value is PenLineCap.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field EndLineCapProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

LineJoin

Gets or sets the type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline.

public System.Windows.Media.PenLineJoin LineJoin { get; set; }
Value
PenLineJoin

The type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline. The default value is PenLineJoin.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field LineJoinProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

MiterLimit

Gets or sets the limit on the ratio of the miter length to half this pen's stem.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness*.

public double MiterLimit { get; set; }
Value
Double

The limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the pen's stem.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness*. This value is always a positive number greater than or equal to 1. The default value is 10.0.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

A miter is a joint made by beveling each of two surfaces to be joined to form a corner. When two line segments meet at a sharp angle, the miter may extend beyond the thickness of the line that strokes the path.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field MiterLimitProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

StartLineCap

Gets or sets the type of shape to use at the beginning of a stroke.

public System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap StartLineCap { get; set; }
Value
PenLineCap

The type of shape that starts the stroke. The default value is PenLineCap.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field StartLineCapProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Thickness

Gets or sets the thickness of the stroke produced by this Pen.

public double Thickness { get; set; }
Value
Double

The thickness of the stroke produced by this Pen. Default is 1.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Thickness is relative to the geometry of the shape associated with this pen. Negative values are treated as though they were positive.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field ThicknessProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this Pen, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Pen Clone ();
Returns
Pen

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this Pen object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Pen CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
Pen

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.
